derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from French, ultimately of imitative origin

entry.tran: (宣告特别事件时演奏的)响亮短曲
entry.def: A fanfare is a short, loud tune played on trumpets or other similar instruments to announce a special event.

example.ex: The ceremony opened with a fanfare of trumpets.
example.tran: 仪式以一曲嘹亮的小号短曲开场。

entry.def: If something happens with a fanfare, it happens or is announced with a lot of publicity. If something happens without a fanfare, it happens without a lot of fuss or publicity.

example.ex: The company was privatised with a fanfare of publicity...
example.tran: 公司的私有化搞得沸沸扬扬。

example.ex: The departure of the South Korean prime minister was marked with little fanfare.
example.tran: 韩国首相悄无声息地离开了。

means.word_mean: 2. (music) a short lively tune played on brass instruments;

sentences.sentence: "he entered to a flourish of trumpets"
"her arrival was greeted with a rousing fanfare"

auth_sentence.content: With very little fanfare Parliament passed a Clean Air Act.
auth_sentence.res_content: With very little fanfare Parliament passed a Clean Air Act.

auth_sentence.content: This has sneaked out, with no fanfare to speak of.

auth_sentence.content: Eddie Mair's PM blog has been launched with great fanfare.

sentences.en: A wreath was laid on the monument to a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.cn: 在响亮的号角声中花圈被献在纪念碑前。

sentences.en: A fanfare of trumpets heralded the arrival of the King.
sentences.cn: 嘹亮的小号声宣告了国王驾到。
